description.narrative: - Employment generation: Between 900-1800 employees are expected to be hired for the constructino of the hotel and residences. During operations, the hotel is expected to employ 500 full-time employees (80% from the Dominican Republic and at least 50% will be women). - Linkages, supply chain development, and SME growth: The Project's linkages with the rest of the economy will initially involve building materials and the construction sectors, and will then reach the agribusiness and services sectors during the operational stage. - Capacity building: Tropicalia will dedicate significant attention and resources to training its labor force and its suppliers. - Contribution to GDP and tax revenue: The Project will generate taxes (i.e. VAT, room taxes, property taxes, etc.), and will contribute to the domestic economy through compensation to staff, procurement of goods and services, and consumer spending. - Infrastructure: The Project will be built in an underdeveloped area and will therefore require significant up-front investments in infrastructure such as water, power, and waste management, among others. Through these supporting investments, the Project is expected to have a catalytic impact in the wider Miches region.

mailing-address.narrative: Cisneros Real Estate Nastasha Monell Marketing & Communications Manager (305) 423-2466 nmonell@cisneros.com 121 Alambra Plaza, Suite 1400, Coral Gables, FL, 33134
